_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
                                                              ELDORADO, IL  -NH3 SITE

1.   FACILITY ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY.

      THE MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES OF SOURTHERN FS, INC ARE COMMITTED TO THE
      PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTIAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  IF AN ACCIDENTIAL
      RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPT.,
      OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE 
      TO PEOPLE AND ENVIRONMENT.

2.   THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED.

      THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY, WHICH IS LOCATED AT 55 BOURLAND ROAD ELDORADO, IL,  IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS FOR  SALE TO FARMERS. ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED , STORED AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION AS A CROP PRODUCTION NUTRIENT.
THE STORAGE AND HANDLING SYSTEM CONSISTS OF 1 STORAGE TANK (18,000 GALLONS), LOADING RISERS, ASSOCIATED PLUMBING AND NURSE TANKS.  ACCESS TO THE SITE IS RESTRICTED TO AUTHORIZED FACILITY EMPLOYEES, AUTHORIZED MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL AND AUTHORIZED CONTRACTORS.

      THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT CAN BE STORED WOULD BE 190,000
      POUNDS. THIS INCLUDES ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT COULD BE STORD IN NURSE TANKS.



3.   THE ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

      THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION RULE AND WITH ALL
      APPLICABLE STATE CODES AND REGULATIONS.  THIS FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS
      OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, 
       K-61.1", PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC. AS ADOPTED BY
      STATE REGULATION AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH
      ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS 
      AMMONIA".  COMPLIANCE WITH THESE  REGULATIONS A

ND ON-GOING TRAINING OF OUR EMPLOYEES
      MAKE UP OUR ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

4.   FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY.

      THERE WAS ONE ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE ON 2-23-2002 AT APPROXIMATELY 10:00 PM .THE RELEASE WAS             
      CAUSED BY THE ATTEMPTED STEALING OF NH3 FROM A NURSE TANK.  THE APPROXIMATE AMOUNT WAS
      970LBS.  THERE WAS ONE REPORTED INJURY WHEN A LOCAL RESIDENT GOING TO WORK DROVE THRU
      THE RELEASE ON HIGHWAY 142 NORTH OF ELDORADO, IL.  THE INJURED RESIDENT WAS TREATED AT 
      THE LOCAL EMERGENCY ROOM AND RELEASED. 

5.    THE FACILITY HAS A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA 
       STANDARD, 29 CFR 1910.38;

       PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES  THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY 
       RIGHT- TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III (EPCRA);

       IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGECY INVOLVING ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY
       THE ELDORADO FIRE DEPARTMENT AND THE SALINE COUNTY LEPC.

6.    PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.

      SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE
      PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS.  THERE ARE NO SPECIFIC 
      SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
